description: A new Space Battleship Yamato project which is a sequel to the Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2205: Aratanaru Tabidachi films.

title.native: 宇宙戦艦ヤマト2205 新たなる旅立ち

node.description:
Yoshinobu Nishizaki was best known as the co-creator of Space Battleship Yamato. He was born in 1934 and graduated from Nihon University Art Department.

In 1994 he designed Yamato 2520. But in the end he was sued by Matsumoto Leiji for breach of copyright. Since then he has been arrested for gun and drug offences. Later in 2002 the court ruled that Nishizaki was the original author and owner of the copyright for Uchuu Senkan Yamato. Matsumoto appealed but settled out of court in 2003 in agreement that Nishizaki was the author.

He passed away on November 7th, 2010 at the age of 75 when he fell from a research steamboat, named Yamato, to the sea near Chichijima island and drowned.

(Source: AniDB)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chinbotsuyamatn)
Affiliated with [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/Satelight).
[Website](https://www.fukuiharutoshi.jp/)

Composer of various games and anime, notably Space Battleship Yamato.

Died of heart failure at the age of 75 on March 21, 2006.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1521695330)

Currently working as a freelancer, having previously worked for [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) and [D.A.S.T.](https://anilist.co/studio/6255/)

Yuuki graduated from Saitama Prefectural Toda Shoyo High School and has been active in the school's "Manga and Anime Research Interest Club.” He found business in the National Health Insurance but couldn't give up on being an animator, so he left and became an animator instead. Has collaborated with director [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/) many times, including on his most famous work, [The Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/).

He works on doujinshi under the circles The Man in the High Castle and Ubik, both references to the works of American science fiction author Philip K. Dick. The published doujinshi include key animation from his body of work and specially drawn manga. On the other hand, since he worked on Ralphilia Saga by [Akara Arisato](https://anilist.co/staff/149449/), he has been involved in several works as a guest member of the doujin circle La Moon.
[Website](https://www.fukuiharutoshi.jp/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidekiokahideki)

[Website](https://akira-miyagawa.com/) | [Blog](https://akira-miyagawa.com/blog-sub/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akiramiyagawa)

Akira Miyagawa is a Japanese composer, arranger, music director and pianist. Born in Tokyo, he is the son of famous composer [Hiroshi Miyagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/110495/Hiroshi-Miyagawa).

He made his debut as a composer on shows at Tokyo Disney Land and Shiki Theatre Company. His motto is "Concerts are entertainments". Performing his concerts in all over Japan, he composed and appeared in many TV shows for NHK. He is also active in other range of fields such as animation, films, and television dramas.

In 2012, he composed and recreated the original score by his father for the remake of [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/12029/Star-Blazers-Space-Battleship-Yamato-2199/), as well as its sequels.
[Website](https://www.fukuiharutoshi.jp/)
__Mika Akitaka__ is a Japanese illustrator, game creator and character, mechanical and prop designer
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shukanematsu) | [Staff Page (Nichion)](https://www.nichionsakka.com/shu-kanematsu)
[Website](https://coraldesign.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ecoley)
__Hobbies:__ Fishing, Golf, Music

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/阿久悠)	

He was famous for thousands of his lyrics he contributed to many recording artists since 1967. Mainly during the 1970s, more than 20 of them reached the number-one on the Japanese Oricon chart, and 7 singles sold more than a million copies. Over 500 of his compositions released as a single have entered the Japanese record charts, and they sold in excess of 68 million copies from 1968 to 2007, making him the most commercially successful Japanese lyricist which was followed by Matsumoto Takashi and Komuro Tetsuya.

Throughout his 40-year career as a lyricist, Aku won the Japan Record Award for five times. He was also acclaimed as a novelist, producing several award-winning works. In 1999, Aku received the Medal with Purple Ribbon from the Government of Japan, in honour of his long-term contributions for the country's entertainment.

Composer of various games and anime, notably Space Battleship Yamato.

Died of heart failure at the age of 75 on March 21, 2006.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/川口真)

__[Website](http://takuyawatanabe.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuya88699231)__

__Birthplace:__ Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan

__Takuya Watanabe__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, music producer and guitarist.

**Height:** 174 cm (5'8.5")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/onoDofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/onodofficial/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHuKRxu3ILwezuNBjpxkIxg) | [Website](http://daisukeono.com/) | [Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist.php?id=f4165cba759b0eccd6448d4e72b4d9ad)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Jing Yuan - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Wriothesley - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Van Arkride - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
